intro: [WRONG START] Origanum vulgage var. formosanum, commonly known as Chinese oregano, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Its essential oils contain compounds like carvacrol and thymol, which contribute to its strong fragrance and medicinal properties. This variant is valued in traditional Chinese medicine and culinary applications for its distinctive flavor and aroma.
